moves.1. e4: Again I have a hard opponent, but he plays predictable - Slav and Sicilian. I decided to swim into his waters preparing surprises.
moves.5... Qc7: 5. ... Qc7! here I secured c4 against white's bishop - often played by my opponent in his games. Let say - my first surprise.
moves.6. cxd4 e6 7. Bd2:
7. Bd2 ?!
It was interesting here what will play my opponent. He follows the theory. But was it his best move ? Black's position looks strong.
moves.7... d6 8. Nc3: I decided to exchange the knights here restricting black's bishop by his own pawns.
moves.8... Nxc3 9. bxc3: and we have interesting position with no any advantage to the whites.
moves.9... Nd7 10. Bb5:
10. Bb5 ?!
I expected here 10. Qa4 - a better move in my opinion.
moves.10... Be7:
10. ... Be7!
I follow the black's plan. I would have play the same even if white have played 10. Qa4.
moves.11. O-O O-O: and we almost completed our developments
moves.13. h3:
13. h3 ?! 
I didn't find the idea of that move.
moves.13... b6: it's time to complete black's development - make ready Bb7 !
moves.16. Bd3: white regroups against black's king side
moves.16... Nf6:
16. ... Nf6 !!
Some reinforcement. But that one move rescued the game and secured the victory !
moves.17. c4:
17. c4 ?
I've expected this center attack but white played 17. c4 ? emotionally and made his first mistake into the game
moves.17... Bxf3: 17. ... Bxf3 ! of course- wining a pawn, one center pawn !
moves.18. Qxf3 Qxd4: and black crowned a victory in the center
moves.19. Rad1:
19. Rad1 !
and now black queen is into danger - 20.Bxh6 ... 21.Bh7+ and the queen is dead. So it's time to  retreat
moves.20. Re2 Rac8 21. Be3 Qc6: I offered queens exchange here having a pawn plus and solid position
moves.22. Qg3: but white are insidious. They know very well the game flows in muddy stream
moves.24. Bxh6:
24. Bxh6 ?!
gradually losing the battle white decided to rush attack
moves.24... gxh6:
24. ... gxh6 ! 
for sure. white missed one flying jump of the vindicator knight
moves.25... Ng8:
25. ... Ng8 !! 
this move exactly smashed the last hope of the white
moves.26. Qh5 f5:
26. ... f5 !! 
again surprise and the blak are safeguarded
moves.28. Kf1 Rg7 29. f3 Rg5 30. Qh4 Rd8: I'm waiting now f4 slacking whites position
moves.31... Rd4:
31. ... Rd4 !
both rooks into the center !
moves.32. Bc2 Rxd1+: for sure. now the way of the black bishop is not obstructed and a nice combination is to follow
moves.33. Bxd1 Qf3+:
33. ... Qf3 + !!
if 34. gxf3 Rg1 #, if 34. Rf2 Qxd1#
the only defence is 34. Ke1 Rxg2 ! 
white resign
